intro: Leucojum trichophyllum subsp. micranthum, commonly known as the small white bellflower, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is typically found in woodland and shaded areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate appearance and early spring blooming habit. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized landscapes.
